description: Borrowed from Yiddish שלומפּ‎ (shlump, “stupid, foolish, or inept person”). Compare obsolete German Schlumpe (modern Schlampe).

entries.meaning: (slang, originally US) Someone who is lazy, slovenly, or dull-looking.

verbs.description: schlump (third-person singular simple present schlumps, present participle schlumping, simple past and past participle schlumped)

entries.meaning: (slang, intransitive) To move in a heavy, lazy or slovenly way.
